intro: Melanthera linearis, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its linear leaves and clustered inflorescence are notable botanical features. It is often used in herbal medicine for its aromatic properties.
